### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* #18479 (RPC: Show fee in results for signrawtransaction* for segwit inputs by luke-jr)

If you consider this pull reques
<!--4a62be1de6b64f3ed646cdc7932c8cf5-->\nðŸ•µï¸ @sipa @fjahr have been requested to review this pull request as specified in the REVIEWERS file.

> All findings are made by a cool static analyzer, aren't they?

Yes, `cppcheck` should have the credit for these findings :)

To reproduce:

```
$ CPPCHECK_VERSION=2.3
$ curl -s https://codeload.github.com/danmar/cppcheck/tar.gz/${CPPCHECK_VERSION} | tar -zxf - --directory /tmp/
$ (cd /tmp/cppcheck-${CPPCHECK_VERSION}/ && make CFGDIR=/tmp/cppcheck-${CPPCHECK_VERSION}/cfg/ > /dev

Er, would it be alright if I changed the `Workspace` here back to non-const? I'd interpret Workspace as an "in-out" parameter used throughout `MemPoolAccept::AcceptSingleTransaction`. As I understand it, this PR makes it `const` for 2 of the intermediate steps based on some code analysis, but I think it might just be coincidentally unmodified inside those functions ðŸ˜… I'd like to be able to update
Sure, just remove the `const` again. While the changes here are correct (as in adding a `const` will still compile), they probably don't make sense conceptually.

@glozow Absolutely! What is `const` is not necessarily const over time :)\n\nThe [C++ const correctness FAQ (isocpp.org)](https://isocpp.org/wiki/faq/const-correctness) is great reading on the topic!
